alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 9:11PM CDT until March 26 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 911 PM CDT, Emergency Management reported a mudslide on Needham Road, partially blocking one lane. Additional road closures are also being reported due to thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Needham area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Butler, Red Springs, Land, West Butler, Bogueloosa, Needham, Jackson Spur, Mount Sterling, Hodgewood, Little Walker, Okatuppa, Hinton, Eiler, Lavaca and Melvin. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
